intro: Urceola malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca urn plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its unique urn-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect herb with opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color and are borne in terminal clusters. Urceola malaccensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is found in moist, shaded environments in its native habitat.
